page.title: 20ROADS AND ROAD TRANSPORT.
page.content: The "D Block is overwhelmingly rural,with in reality only two important roads traversing the area,namely the B4451 passing through Butlers Marston,and the ancient Roman road "The Fosse way".The Fosseway runs from the bottom left hand corner of the "D Block"- north passing to the west of Combrook with a spur to the village.The road then runs to its first main population centre Leicester in the north and Stow to the south.The main characteristic of the road is its straightness,allowing the traffic to move speedily.At peak traffic times the road is very busy indeed and quite comparable to a very busy road in any urban area,for it must be remembered that this is a largely commuting area. That this ancient road should be so prominent in this backwater of England is somehow appropriate.
